subject: Re: JUnit 3.5 & Ant 1.3
msgSnippet: ... I never had to do steps three or four from your list.  Are you sure there is no other ant.jar somewhere in your CLASSPATH whose task definitions
messageBody:
--- In junit@y..., Fred Loney <loney@s...> wrote:
> I encountered this problem, and had to do the following:
>
> o add junit.jar to the classpath of the ant executable
> o add the ant optional jar to the classpath of the ant executable
> o aadd junit.jar to the classpath of the junit task
> o explicitly define the junit task

I never had to do steps three or four from your list. Are you sure
there is no other ant.jar somewhere in your CLASSPATH whose task
definitions (defaults.properties) hides the one of Ant 1.3?


Stefan
